attributes.action: Privatise the BBC as we did with other public services
attributes.background: Can we trust the BBC? Is it impartial? Does it have a political agenda? How does it spend the billions of pounds it receives in tax payers money? Why does the BBC exist?
attributes.additional_details: It is an unaccountable tax payer funded organisation. Admittedly it makes some good programs, but give anyone a couple of billion pounds and its likely they'll make a good program. What is the BBC's overseas policy? WHO actually does the BBC answer to?

attributes.action: Refuse RSPCA entering homes/property to seize animals without permission/police.
attributes.background:
The RSPCA is seeking new powers in England and Wales to search some private property, including sheds and gardens, without a police warrant.
It also wants inspectors who have been invited to enter a home to be able to "seize animals in distress" without awaiting a police presence.

attributes.action: Make the motor trade require a licence to be a mechanic
attributes.background: The motor trade unlike all other trades doesn't require a licence for the tradesmen and women to work. Garages can employ anybody as a mechanic. Unlike plumbers for example who need licences to work. A licence would ensure mechanics are capable of doing the job to a reasonable standard and safely.

attributes.action: Introduce an emergency alert text system nationally
attributes.background: The UK is now on the highest terrorist threat level, yet again. I personally believe it is unacceptable that our general public are not notified of horrific events that happen, endangering our safety. I believe a system should be introduced, like in the USA, alerting the public via text.
attributes.additional_details: It could also be used to alert the public of missing people, etc. I feel unsafe walking in city areas so close to people knowing the horrific events that happened recently. If people were to be alerted, it'd give them a better chance of evacuating the area. Theresa May says an attack is imminent, we CANNOT wait until another attack happens to take action. The system in the US uses phone masts to alert everyone who's connected in the area. The President can alert the whole country at once too.

attributes.action: Fund free rail travel to school for children
attributes.background:
Kids travel free on buses and trams, but pay for rail.
Children should be encouraged to go by rail.
Roads would be less congested. Rail is safer.
They would be more likely to use rail when they grow up.
The UK Government should therefore fund free rail travel for school children.

attributes.action: Alter the definition of rape under English law to include assault by penetration
attributes.background: The Sexual Offences Act 2003 states that rape is where "[the rapist] intentionally penetrates the vagina, anus or mouth of another person B with his penis" and "B does not consent". People who are raped using an object or fingers are said to have been 'assaulted by penetration' and not raped.
attributes.additional_details: Using 'assault by penetration' to legally describe this act of rape downplays the experiences of people who have suffered in this way, and could prevent them from getting the support they need from rape shelters and therapy. It could cause additional psychological harm by preventing them from coming to terms with what happened to them, since 'assault by penetration' does not have the same stigma as the word 'rape'. So-called 'assault by penetration' can also cause PTSD, as can rape and other forms of sexual assault. The definition is also too simplistic as it does not take into account lack of consent in LGBT+ interactions and relationships, and implies that only men can rape.

attributes.action: Make it law for every alcohol transaction to require approved photo ID
attributes.background: Many shop assistants every day are physically or verbally abused for asking for proof of age when purchasing alcohol a simple change to the law requiring that approved ID must be shown for every transaction would help reduce attempted under age purchases and remove cashier errors in assessing age
attributes.additional_details:
A simple law that states no ID no sale on alcohol would remove the possibility of human error in judging people's ages and would help to Reduce verbal and physical confrontations if customers knew the law was no ID no sale.
Across the country workers have been subjected to abuse because of guessing a customers age who subsequently causes a scene in an attempt to intimidate the cashier into selling the product.
A No ID no sale law would be a simple fix so everyone knows where they stand.

attributes.action: Scrap credit card age verification on pornographic sites
attributes.background: The approach to the UK Digital Economy Act Section 3 on Online Pornography which requires every pornographic site to have age verification by holding credit card information of users is completely misguided and shows ministers have a complete lack of understanding of how the internet works.
attributes.additional_details: This will lead to porn companies storing vast amounts of credit card information which could easily be subject to hacking. Porn sites wont necessarily have the proper security. VPN, Tor Browser, proxy search or a torrent make age verification pointless with easy work arounds. Tor Browsers could lead to young people accessing content that is banned/illegal in the UK such as rape & child pornography videos on the dark web. Fraudulent porn sites could also potentially steal credit card information.

attributes.action: Emotional Assistance Pet Act Urgently Needed
attributes.background: To grant the right for people in rented accommodation who are struggling with emotional distress, depression – to keep a pet regardless of any “No Pet Clause”.

attributes.action: make the punishment for stealing tools from tradesmens vehicles harsher.
attributes.background: There seems to be a marked increase in thefts of tools from trade vehicles. Most of the people affected are self employed so the actual cost to them cannot be quantified. They lose work have to spend money replacing thousands of pounds of tools often accumulated over many years.

attributes.action: Prevent the tunnel proposals for the A303 under Stonehenge.
attributes.background: Stonehenge is a historic world heritage sight and the proposals to construct a tunnel will seriously damage the local wildlife and the countryside around the famous and ancient historical sight.

attributes.action: Reduce the amount of time from 5 years to 3 for a divorce without consent.
attributes.background: You can divorce with their consent after 2 years separation but if they decide not to consent you then have to wait 5 years and you can divorce without their consent. 5 years is too long and more than double the 2 years with consent.

attributes.action: Guarantee equal or better funding for scientific research in the UK after Brexit
attributes.background: We rely heavily on EU research funding ~€1.2 billion p.a. from Horizon 2020, there is no clear plan on how this will be replaced after Brexit. I ask that the future funding is guaranteed and extra UK grants are made that at least match or better the input from Horizon 2020 to UK HE institutions.
attributes.additional_details:
At time of writing, there is no deal for joint EU-UK research funding after Brexit. The UK will not have access to the same amount of funding and hundreds of top level research jobs will be lost due to the shortfall, unless the UK government increases domestic research budgets. https://ec.europa.eu/unitedkingdom/news/uk-institutions-and-researchers-top-recipients-eu-innovation-funding_en

UK HE institutes received ~€1.2 billion in 2015 http://ec.europa.eu/budget/figures/interactive/index_en.cfm

attributes.action: To make a new Act of Parliament, namely, The Protection from Online Bullying Act
attributes.background:
Online Bullying has become very wide spread on social media and educational forums causing emotional and psychological suffering, and in some cases even suicide.  
It is not enough to report online bullying, the Search Engines need to be compelled to have sanctions in place to deter the bullies.
attributes.additional_details:
Because there is not an specific Act in place to compel online bullies to behave in a reasonable way, their behaviour causes damage to people's lives, and, there needs to be a law with sanctions to prevent this from happening.
Without a  law to deter cyber-bullying with sanctions, it will snowball out of control, as the evidence in the media indicates.

attributes.action: Install ANPR systems on the A2 junction with the A282.
attributes.background: Drivers bypass the A282 by using the A2 junction roundabout and then the A225 junction when the traffic is bad. This causes severe delays to Dartford residents going about their daily business. Drivers doing this show no consideration to other drivers and they should be fined for using this dodge.
attributes.additional_details: I live in DA1 and it once took 45 minutes to get to Asda Greenhithe because of this level of inconsiderate driving. Yesterday it accounted for nearly 20 minutes of delay because of HGV drivers blocking the A225 Princes Road junction with the roundabout. Local residents have the right to go about their daily business without the fear of being delayed by such inconsiderate drivers, who are only interested in themselves. Plus there are frequent law infringements on this roundabout.

attributes.action: Make FCO Consular Services statutory, defined and guaranteed
attributes.background: FCO Consular Service is subject to abuse and discrimination. British nationals abroad cannot rely upon the published FCO Customer Charter, as it has an enormous caveat; all help is discretionary, not statutory. British nationals currently have no recourse against the FCO for failing to help them.
attributes.additional_details: Cases prove that one British national will receive consular service while another does not for the exact same needs. The Gillian Gibbons Sudan case proved that the FCO will intervene significantly more the less important the country. Brexit especially requires that the FCO publish a charter that they will honour for each and every British citizen abroad irrespective of the country involved. Also that the FCO is more proactive in cases of civil and human rights abuse.

attributes.action: Allow Tyler the Creator back into the UK
attributes.background:
Tyler, The Creator claims he has been banned from the UK.
The US rapper says he is not allowed to enter the country for "three to five years" because of lyrics he wrote in 2009.
The co-founder of hip-hop collective Odd Future has always attracted controversy.
attributes.additional_details: Freedom of speech is the right to articulate one's opinions and ideas without fear of government retaliation or censorship, or societal sanction. The term freedom of expression is sometimes used synonymously, but includes any act of seeking, receiving and imparting information or ideas, regardless of the medium used. This right has been incorporated into the Human Rights Act in 1998 and is still used today.

attributes.action: Increase efficiency of motorways by permitting overtaking on the left.
attributes.background: The UK motorway network is one of the most congested in Europe. The UK government are spending £ millions implementing "smart motorways" to help increase efficiency. The problem is NOT just volume of traffic, but because motorists don't abide by Highway code rule 264 leading to 'empty lanes'.
attributes.additional_details: Penalties to motorists ignoring rule 264 (keeping in the left lane unless overtaking) were introduced, but the decrease in motorway police patrols means this rarely enforced. Many motorists still habitually drive in Lane 2 while Lane 1 is empty;this forces all faster moving traffic into Lane 3 so becomes full 'nose to tail' and motorways operate below optimum capacity. By allowing overtaking on the left (as the USA) ALL lanes of motorways would be fully utilised to increase capacity at no cost.

attributes.action: Prevent the current changes to pharmacy regulations being debated by the DoH
attributes.background: The planned changes to pharmacy regulations aim to allow a pharmacy to open and allow prescription-only medicines to be given out without a Responsible Pharmacist present. This will inevitably result in both patient harm and reduced access to pharmacy services for patients.
attributes.additional_details: The government has said that they wish to "better utilise the skills of pharmacists in healthcare settings such as hospitals and GP practices", but have put no proposals forward to guarantee jobs for the many community pharmacists and Locums that this will put out of work. People who have been at the heart of the community helping patients will now find themselves without work, and those patients will find they have reduced access to pharmacy services.

attributes.action: Maternity pay to reflect your regular salary.
attributes.background: Maternity pay is the same for everyone regardless of their usual earnings. A part time colleague took her full maternity leave as her pay was similar to her usual salary. I feel discriminated as a higher earner as I will need to return to work early as I will lose £1200 per month on maternity pay.

attributes.action: Companies must be required to specify what animal gelatine is in their products
attributes.background: In my case, I have found that it is a common theme to find that "gelatine" is an ingredient to many confectionery items. This itself presents a grave concern, as I am a follower of the Islamic faith, who does not eat pork. Thus, failure to specify the type of gelatine is misleading.
attributes.additional_details: The rationale of ingredients being displayed on the back of food packaging is that we are in a position to exercise our autonomy. So, we can make an informed decision of whether or not it is something we wish to consume. This detail should be a basic requirement for all product packaging and be given the attention similar to allergy warnings. This applies to many sectors of society Muslims, Judaism, Hinduism, Sikhism and sects of Christianity. Therefore, essential in such a diverse society.

attributes.action: Get rid of all school uniforms
attributes.background: I personally find most school uniforms ridiculously uncomfortable and believe that we, as students, should be able to wear anything we like to school within reason. I also believe that if anyone should go to school in a uniform, it should be the teachers.

attributes.action: Allow everyone over 55 flexibility to manage their private pension
attributes.background: The Pension Schemes Act 2015 allowed individuals from the age of 55 to be able to access their pension flexibility if they wish, but not if you had already accessed your pension prior to the new Act coming into force. I want this Government to give us the same rights to manage our pension as we wish
